content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

In Julia, you can use the `filter` function to iterate over a list and remove elements that do not meet a certain condition. In this case, the condition is that the word should start with a capital letter. Here is how you can implement this function:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(word -> isuppercase(word[1]), words)
end
```

In this function, `filter` applies the function `word -> isuppercase(word[1])` to each element in `words`. This function checks if the first character of the word is an uppercase letter. If it is, the word is included in the output; if it is not, the word is excluded.

You can use this function like this:

```julia
words = ["Dog", "dog", "Cat", "cat", "Mouse", "mouse"]
names = keep_only_names(words)
println(names)  # prints: ["Dog", "Cat", "Mouse"]
```

This will print only the words that start with a capital letter.
